properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 3:25PM EST until February 11 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg
has issued a Flood Advisory for the Tuckasegee River at Bryson City
affecting Swain County...

.Heavy rain will increase across the region through tonight resulting
in rising river levels once again...

The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a
* Flood Advisory for The Tuckasegee River At Bryson City.
* from this evening to Tuesday morning.
* At 2 PM Monday the stage was 4.9 feet.
* Action Stage is 8.0 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet.
* FORECAST: The river will rise to near 9.5 feet by Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS: At 9.0 feet: River will overflow its banks and will begin
to move into the Bear Hunter Campground near Bryson City.
* IMPACTS: At 10.0 feet: Low lying areas between Bryson Walk and the
river will flood. Upstream between Main Street and the river, low
lying areas including parts of the Bear Hunter Campground will flood.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory for a river forecast point means that nuisance
flooding is expected to occur along the river when the river level is
forecast to be just below or at the official  flood stage.
